Reviews.Title: “Decent enough if you're on a budget”
Reviews.Author: stash212
Reviews.Content: This was our second trip to Barcelona and I can't wait to return to this wonderful city, previously we had stayed at the Hilton Diaganol Mar which is a few blocks away from this property. Sadly a last minute trip budget didn't stretch to the cover price of the Hilton this time so we decided we would like to stay in a similar area and settled on the Hesperia Del Mar. The hotel itsself was fine nothing much wrong with it apart from the small details that really make a difference. The hotel is looking quite old and tired in parts now, the reception areas are pleasant but the bedrooms are small and cramped with not much space for luggage and two people. We were travelling with another two people who reserved a twin room which was larger and more comfortable than our double. I would recommend this is as a decent 3 star rather than the 4 star rating it currently holds. The staff were pleasant although we were awoken each morning by the cleaning staff slamming doors and speaking at high volumes in the corridors. Overall a decent enough stay but if you want a luxury trip this isn't the hotel, if on a budget its adequate.

Reviews.Title: “Close to beach, but quite old”
Reviews.Author: Lucky1602
Reviews.Content: We have traveled with friends to Barcelona for both, beach and culture. For beach the location is perfect, just cross the road and zou can enjoy the sun. But for city centre and other points of interest the location is poorer, also the metro station is quite far by walk, count on 10 -15 min by walk. Hotel is nice, but older. What I do have to mention is poor breakfast. However, staff is typical spanish, very friendly and helpfull.

Reviews.Title: “Good for a beach vacation”
Reviews.Author: cristinablendea
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in the summer of 2006. The main purpose of my vacation that time was a concert and the beach and this hotel is perfect for that. Given its location close to the beach it's not the best choice if you want to be in the heart of the city, but it's comfortable and getting to the city is not too difficult. We got a good deal for our five-day-stay but I see it's a bit more expensive now so I'm not sure I would stay there again. But it's a nice, fresh hotel with reasonable size clean and modern rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hans M Posted by a NH Hoteles traveler
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in the hotel a few days ago. The room was great. The staff are perfect. The only thing I really missed is free Wifi at the hotel room. I needed it for my work.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious, clean, pleasant, great service”
Reviews.Author: sinatramania
Reviews.Content: We loved staying at this property. Keep in mind it has been a few years since we did (August of 2008) However I was asked recently where to stay in Barcelona and this wonderful hotel came to mind immediately. The staff was amazing, they upgraded us to an Ocean view room at no extra cost. Wonderful location, close enough to las Ramblas but far enough to get a quiet night away from the nightlife. The room, hallways, lobby were immaculate clean, the room was big, which if you have been to Europe, you'll know how much of a plus this is. And the price at that time was great.

Reviews.Title: “OK for a meeting but not a holiday”
Reviews.Author: Skippy50
Reviews.Content: Budget price hotel, across a noisy, major road from the sea - don't try to cross it easily- that was clean and just ok. Then again, rates were low. The majority of staff were friendly but restaurant manager appeared rushed and grumpy. Reception had a certain Spanish flair and belied restbof hotel. Room was fairly basic but adequatly furnished, though had to be moved since there was no lock on balcony door. Room was either too cold of two hot and extra bedding provided was very thin. I felt that although a modern hotel, it has seen better day with many of the staff with frayed shirt collars and cuffs - in reception and restaurant: this was not very inspiring. Meeting room was again adequate but soulless. Next door to a pharmacy which may be useful, and adjacent to restaurants - but not highest quality. If you need a low cost meeting room etc then the Hesperia Del Mar may be what you are looking for.n

Reviews.Title: “Very nice! Great rooms, good lication, kid friendly! Very very clean!”
Reviews.Author: MomisR
Reviews.Content: The staff are super friendly! Really refreshing!!! The rooms are big, big bathrooms. We got a 4 year old with us & with out asking the add another bed so we have automatic 2 rooms plus we have 2 bathrooms 1 with tub another with shower! Is near a lot of transportation (bus, subway & taxi's) is usually 9 euros from hotel to plaza la Catalonia (down town) in taxi for 3 people! We are across the beach so for those joggers is great to hit the boardwalk and jogg for miles! Lots of restaurants around! Convenient stores & pharmacy outside! Plus if you take Turistic tours they pass outside!!!! (green line roud) Love it! Over all great choice! Also very safe part of town!!!! You can walk outside with no problems!

Reviews.Title: “A bit far from City Center”
Reviews.Author: Montrealeronthemove
Reviews.Content: We were at the Hesperia Del Mar in October 2011. The hotel is nice and well located near the sea. There are plenty of Restaurant on the main street in front (Passeig Garcia Farria) as well as just behind the hotel on street like passeig Taulat and surronding streets. The hotel is considered as a 4-star hotel but it is really a 3-star. The entrance is a bit strange as you have to go down to a lower level than the street to get in. There is though a small elevator to get there if you have heavy suitcases or for handicapped people. The room we had 111 was rather small but the bathroom was spacious, and had bath, shower and bidet (see pictures). The hotel is quiet and that room gave on a park behind the hotel. The staff is friendly and helpful. We have asked about restaurant and were always well advised. For anyone interested, there is a Hotel and restauration School just on the street behind called Escola Hotelera de Barceloa (on passeig Taulat) and they serve fabulous meals from Monday to Friday. We went to their upscale restaurant and a 5-course meal for supper costed 21 euros. The nearest subway stations (there are 2 at equal distances) are Poble Nou and Selva de Mar, at around 10 minutes walk. The bus # 41 passes in front on Passeig Garcia Farria and will get you to Plaza Catalunya which is the center of Barcelona, where you can walk to Las Ramblas and the trip takes about 20 minutes. This bus will also go near the Arc de Triumf and the Barcelona Zoo. All in all it is a good hotel but I would say it is a bit pricy for the quality you get.

Reviews.Title: “A nice hotel let down by its location”
Reviews.Author: pb1642
Reviews.Content: My trip was on business and my company booked me into the Hesperia Del Mar it would not have been a choice for a personal trip but it was close enough to the CCIB (conference centre) for a welcome brisk 15 minute walk at the start and end of the day. My room was clean and comfortable and the bed was OK if a little firm for my taste. The staff were also very welcoming and friendly. From an entertainment perspective the hotel falls a little short, English television channels were few, two, and only covered News. The location of the hotel is a good distance from Las Ramblas and so would have required taxi journeys to see any sights. In sum if you are going to the Barcelona CCIB I would recommend the Hesperia but if you are going as a tourist find something closer to the action.

Reviews.Title: “A good place for beach lover”
Reviews.Author: Yujiang
Reviews.Content: We went there to avoid cold winter in Sweden. And it was a great experience to stay in a good and quiet hotel for a week. And I guess the winter price we got is half of the original price. A good value! The hotel is designed good so that every room has a side view of the ocean.

Reviews.Title: “More a good three star than a real 4 star”
Reviews.Author: vituzzo
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Hesperia del Mar one night last September during a business trip with my wife. We were given a double room with a small living room. It looked to me that they have transformed one small single room into living room and connected to a rather smal double room. Overall not a bad idea. The rooms were OK, but showing their age. The same applies for the two bathrooms. Breakfast was OK, with enough choice of cold food. The hotel is located in the north suburbs of Barcelona, near the Forum Convention centre and close to the beach (which is a plus). Overall we had a pleasant stay, with nothing to complain. I would not choose this hotel again, but if I have to attend a meeting in the Forum, the Hesperia del Mar can be a very convenient alternative to the much more expensive hotels in that area of Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice staff”
Reviews.Author: StockholmSwedebear
Reviews.Content: Nice clean hotel just a short walk from the beach Mar Bella. We got a big room, however it didnt have balcony or wifi as the homepage says. Balcony was a whopping €32/night extra charge. When we stayed at the hotel, the restaurant was closed, but in the area there are many small cafes for breakfast, and on rambla de poblenou there are loads of nice restaurants and very nice to spend the the evenings! my favourite is La Biennal, great food and good prices. Over all, this is a great area to live, close to the beach and still walking distance to the city, nice people and great service everywhere! Back to the hotell then, staff was friendly and helpful, room was big and clean with great frigde and ac. Bathroom also good, but the soap in the shower smelled rather bad. Great housekeeping and over all a very pleasant stay. Also the touristbus and the regular tmb bus stays right outside the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The person who wrote the hotel discription has never set foot in it!”
Reviews.Author: Haemboy
Reviews.Content: The person who wrote this hotels description has clearly never set foot in the Hesperia del Mar. They claim the Hesperia del Mar junior suites have a private terrace - this is wrong only 1 junior suite has a small very public balcony area. The chairs on the balcony are so old the varnish on the arms had all peeled off. The sofa in this junior suite is stained & burst. The floors were dirty and not cleaned in the 2 weeks we were there. The view of the Med? yes you can see it - just, between buildings When we first arrived at the hotel we went to the desk to complain about our suite not having the described terrace the staff clearly did not believe us and had to check their own web site! Wifi was only available in the lobby and not in the junior suites as claimed. Just checked the nh Hotels and various hotel booking sites and nothing has changed.

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad”
Reviews.Author: uziej
Reviews.Content: This hotel wasn't bad but what really bothered me was it wasn't as clean as I expect a hotel to be. They cleaned but it was surface clean. The corners weren't cleaned, the phone wasn't wiped down. The room was small but I did't spend time in it. The location was the only good thing. Close to the beach, walking distance to the mall- approx 15mins and 15 to the subway. Would advise to look to stay somewhere else if possible. If your American or Canadian, make sure you bring your own plug converter. They had a bunch but none worked for me. They were helpful if I needed anything or had any questions. Just wasn't clean, Seen a similar review and the pictures they published were spot on.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, price and service”
Reviews.Author: CEBV
Reviews.Content: I stayed there with my mom.. Very nice neighborhood.. not if you want to be close to the nightlife but just across the beach... if you want to go downtown there is bus 41 30 meters from the hotel and a metro station about 10 minute walk. Great room with a mini bar a great prices and the services completed a great couple of days there. Very recommended

Reviews.Title: “What is the point of this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Emmaroe
Reviews.Content: The hotel is bland and its position poor. The staff are polite and acceptable, it is clean and modern – there is really not much wrong with it – if it was 3 star….. But 4 star? Very poor. The room was small and cramped – there was no Info pack in the room, the wardrobe hanging space was miniscule, no room Internet, no bottle of free water. The basin plug didn’t seal (how unusual is that!?). The TV probably was a hand-me-down. The view was over a courtyard with concrete medium and high rises giving maybe 200 flat owners a view into my room and the bathroom had clear glass and large windows. The breakfast was not cheap and decidedly average. What is the point of this hotel?

Reviews.Title: “A well recommended stay”
Reviews.Author: WantToGoAwayMore
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend wanted to get away for his birthday so we took a 6 day stay here, it was so lovely and having a excellent hotel to stay in made it better! The only negatives I have about this hotel is: - The location - The hotel is located in Poblenou within Barcelona, just up the beach. It was fine for us because we love long walks but it took us about an hour to get to La Rambla. If you don't like walking then there is a bus stop next to the hotel and the number 41 bus stops at Placa de Catalunya and is only 1 euro 40! Another way is walking up the road to Poblenou metro station which isn't far. During the summer, the Bus Touristic green route will run near the hotel too but it wasn't running in December so we walked to the end of the road to catch the red route (there are Bus Touristic maps in the hotel), I strongly recommend these busses! - The food prices - Breakfast wasn't included in our package, so we normally walked next door to a small bar/restaurant for coffee and a croissant for 2 euro 10 but one day I thought it would be nice to see what the breakfast buffet was like. It was nice, quiet, peaceful, and the food was lovely, a nice variety! I didn't see a price list anywhere so just assumed it would be on our room bill at the end of the say. It was, and one breakfast was 14 euro! Everything else I loved! The hotel was clean, our towels were done everyday, the maid even put my roses in a glass of water for me! Came everyday at about half 10 so gave us time to get ready. The staff were so friendly. Their English was very good and we stupidly forgot adaptors but the receptionist let us borrow one! Every time we walked in or out of the hotel the person on reception would always say hello which I thought was lovely. At the end of our stay, we had to check out at 12 but because our flight wasn't till the evening she gave us an extra hour free and after that put our luggage in the luggage room so we could come back later. The rooms are really nice, you can choose smoking or non-smoking, we had a nice balcony overlooking the beach and saw the sunrise most days! The bed was huge, king size, with amazing pillows! There was even a pillow leaflet if you wanted different pillows! The mini-bar was good value, all snacks, soft drinks and beer was 2 euro, spirits were 3 euro. There was a safe inside the wardrobe which was free to use and the bathroom was lovely and clean with hair wash, moisturiser, shower gel, a toothbrush kit, shaving kit, sponge and hair cap on the side that got refreshed everyday if you used it. We even used room service once and reception ordered the pizza we wanted for us because we weren't very good at Spanish! Overall we thought the hotel was brilliant and we really enjoyed our stay, we're dying to go to Barcelona again because it is absolutely stunning and there is so much to do and see! We would definately stay here again if we come back! Perhaps in the summer next time because then the walk along the beach to La Rambla would be beautiful and we could sunbathe across the road from the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Comfortable, but take a kettle!”
Reviews.Author: jules0711
Reviews.Content: The female receptionist there was amazing, nothing was too much trouble for her to sort out. A major sticking point for me was that there were no tea & coffee making facilities in the room, hence the title. As other people have picked up on, the walls there are very thin, I was woken up by someone knocking on the door of the neighbouring room. There are also no English language television stations, and only one English language newspaper, which is American. This really is a shame, with a little more attention to detail, this could be a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location for a mixed beach and city break.”
Reviews.Author: Craigo81
Reviews.Content: Myself and my partner (in our late 20s) stayed here for one week at the start of September. We were looking for a holiday which was a combination of a chill out beach holiday and a busy city break and we managed to crack it with Barcelona. We decided it was best to get a hotel next to the beach as most days we started there or featured a whole day there. The Hesperia fitted the bill perfectly. It was literally across the road from the clean and uncrowded Bogatell Beach which you can get to within five minutes. There is a good enough cafe there for food/drinks but if you walk further along the beachside walkways, there is a yacht port where there are plenty of excellent, abeit touristy, restaurants, but ideal if you stay here and are looking for a good meal close by. We spent many afternoons and most evenings in the city. We thought the easiest way to get there was by Metro for which the closest station, Poblenou, is about a 10 minute walk (five/six blocks away). We found this no problem and it also felt relatively safe being in a mainly residential area as we walked it regularly late at night. You could, as we did, get off the metro earlier and walk along the seafront back to the hotel which was a nicer way to walk off the tapas. The city centre was about 10 mins away on the Metro. We found the hotel itself to be clean, comfortable, safe and the staff were friendly. Our standard room was spacious and fine for our needs as we didn't spend a lot of time in it. You don't need to eat breakfast in the hotel - we found a lovely bakery at the end of the same block the hotel is on which sold delicious croissants and coffee for breakfast. The only (minor) complaint about the hotel would be that all the TV Channels were in German or Spanish - as a couple of news junkies it would have been nice to have Sky News or CNN on while we were getting ready but nevermind, who goes on holiday to watch TV anyway??!! So, if you want to be close to the beach and don't mind a ten minute walk to the metro for city access then this would be a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel, a bit far from the center”
Reviews.Author: DLV1975
Reviews.Content: I stayed two nights at this hotel for business. The room was huge with a reasonable living room and two bathrooms, very clean and comfortable bed. The breakfast and meals are very good. Very good price overall. The only inconvenience is that it is a bit far from the center, difficult parking area but hotel has own parking at 11 euros day. I

Reviews.Title: “Really nice place”
Reviews.Author: irka_v
Reviews.Content: Perfect location for beach&city vacation. We asked for room for two with extra bed for kid - and got the room with separate bedroom and living room and 2 separate bathrooms and balcony with a sea view. Unbeatable. Neighbourhood is nice and residential - local cafes, shops not spoiled by tourists, kids on playgrounds etc - so you can feel yourself "at home" coming back from noisy and slightly dangerous city center. Everything in the room worked properly. We never had any problems - even with midnight check-in. Personnel quickly replied all our letters about room, beds, late check-in etc. They even printed out all our letters :) and waited for us in the night. I surely would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: aok47
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. Bus stop is on the main road and takes you into the centre of Barcelona, metro a bit of a walk (~800m). Rooms clean, large, nice bathroom! We paid for parking but you can find on the street and save yourself the daily parking charge of 11euro (which was reasonable compared to other places).

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel, a bit far from the centre”
Reviews.Author: akapaf
Reviews.Content: this hotel is nice and new. good rooms, helpful staff (a part from the waiter in the morning breakfast..), quite good breakfast. it is in a very quiet neighborhood not so near to the centre, but public transportation in barcelona is good, so the position could be not a problem for you. I recommend it for business, and for the good rates, but if you want to visit the city, maybe there are better choices.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing place”
Reviews.Author: JorgeB9
Reviews.Content: Amazing place, people very kind!

Reviews.Title: “Good but not a 4 Star”
Reviews.Author: Haymoon
Reviews.Content: Nice clean hotel with friendly staff and good breakfast. However to my mind the rooms are small for a 4 star. Admittedly there is a balcony for the front of hotel bedrooms but in November not sunny after midday. Although near the beach the surrounding area is very quiet with little of interest. Bus No 41 stops nearby and takes you right into the hub of the shopping centre of Barca - Pl. Catalunya.

Reviews.Title: “beware the neighbourhood”
Reviews.Author: bomaolciarain
Reviews.Content: The hotel is quite pleasant but is devoid of atmosphere.My wife and I walked from the metro-about half a mile. On the way a youth tried to grab my wife's backpack-luckily he failed but the experience was very unpleasant. The wonderful reception staff told us Barcelona is a very dangerous city but they kindly upgraded us to a suite. The hotel reception is below street level and there is a lift down from the street but it never worked for us. Breakfast is good value. One gripe-my visa card had to be swipped on 3 different occasions at reception-check out took ages. I feel this hotel is best suited to business types with self defense skills!!

Reviews.Title: “A nice surprise!”
Reviews.Author: sus67
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed here for a few days in August 2008. After we had booked the hotel, we were a little concerned about the distance from the hotel to the city centre, but our anxieties were rapidly dispelled when we arrived. It is only a 10minute walk to the metro station (Poblenou) and then 20 minutes into the centre. Also, the hotel was practically on the beach, which was marvellous. This part of the beach was quieter than the more tourist orientated ones at Barceloneta and is very well set up: it is one of the few beaches we have been to where disabled people are actively catered for. The hotel itself is quiet, air conditioned and comfortable. The rooms/toilets are spacious and very clean. The staff were polite and knowledgeable. The breakfast was also very good, with a wide selection. Overall, we were very pleased with our find and would probably stay here again on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: Gazpachita
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, about 10 minutes away from subway (not too far), good breakfast, lovey view, clean, nice staff, reasonable price ... can't ask for more!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: KarthikV
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a week. Nice hotel with some rooms facing the sea. There is a bus stop in front of the hotel, so it is very convenient to go to the city center. Metro is a little bit far though. Staff are quite friendly

Reviews.Title: “Okay but not 4 stars”
Reviews.Author: Skovjuul
Reviews.Content: Would not stay here again. Too far from metro, and bad service. But a quiet hotel, no kids running around screaming.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, pleasant hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: Lis3377
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely time in Barcelona in September and stayed in the Hesperia Del Mar. The hotel was great for access into town, only 10 minutes walk to the metro station, then 5-10 mins into town on the metro. Some people commented that the hotel was too far to town, but that is so lazy! It is literally a ten minute walk through a lovely park to the metro stop! The hotel-because it isnt central Barcelona-is in a quiet area, perfect after a day walking all around Barcelona. The facilities were great. Everything was clean and modern. The only thing I would say is that there was only 1 english channel on the tv. But if, like us, you only went back to the room to sleep after a busy day, it was fine. Definately recommended! Barcelona is great.

Reviews.Title: “Dont go here if you want to eat or drink”
Reviews.Author: weejim
Reviews.Content: Rooms fine if small Bar closed due to lack of staff, restuarant appauling, nothing around the hotel open after 8pm. NOT GREAT FOR CONFERENCES

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: munchkin969
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel with all the neccesities. Staff was pleasent with good english. across from the beach and 5 mins to La Ramblas. Have fun.

Reviews.Title: “Near beach, long walk to metro.”
Reviews.Author: ancy999
Reviews.Content: We booked the room for one night on our arrival to Barcelona. The hotel is located near the beach, about 20 min walk from the metro station. Room was good quality so was breakfast. Enjoyed my stay but next time I visit Barcelona, would probably opt for a more central hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Service”
Reviews.Author: The-Mystery-Shopper
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a very long walk from the Metro Station. The food in the hotel is not very nice, my (hot) breakfast was cold, and they still charged me 15 euros. The internet computer was so slow, dont use it unless you really need too. The bed was very unformafortable and the room was dirty. The staff were very unhelpful at times, and there are no restaurant nearby, so stay in the city centre if you are dining.

Reviews.Title: “Not great value”
Reviews.Author: bigmert
Reviews.Content: This is an ok hotel, not great value for the price. This is last row of buildings across the highway from the beach, but perpendicular to the beach. Only a few rooms have beach front views. Free wifi was advertised but there was no signal, the staff wouldn't change the room for that. Friends changed their room because the room smelled. I understand the other comment that it is isolated - the nearest Metro is about 15 minute walk, the longest I've had in a Barcelona hotel. We also stayed in a small hotel near Diagonal, no views but clean, friendly, and conveniently located. So, I can't recommend this hotel for the location - it's only near the beach and most rooms don't have views. It's not well located to a Metro stop, and the price is the similar to other hotels near the beach with views or more conveniently located. It wasn't terrible but I wouldn't go back.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: kumacat
Reviews.Content: It can be isolated for those without a car. We rented a car and was lucky enough to find a space to park every night. A nice clean, comfortable hotel with free internet access. Would choose something nearer to the city next time but wouldn't mind to stay here again for the packaged price we got last time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value hotel with quiet location”
Reviews.Author: Bytel
Reviews.Content: this hotel is a really great quiet Hotel directly opposite the beach, the rooms are modern and clean with great buffet breakfast and attentive staff. Free WiFi is also availlable. The bus goes dirct into the city centre stopping at the main square of PL Catalunya. I have stayed here twice and can confirm that the level of service each time was the same high standard, great for a city break and beach holiday combined and so much quieter and relaxing than city centre hotels.
